channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Characteristics and prevalence of fake social media profiles with AI-generated faces
item.description: Applying this method to a random sample of active Twitter users, we estimate a lower bound for the prevalence of profiles using GAN-generated faces between 0. 021% and 0. 044% -- around 10K daily active accounts.

item.title: Detection and Classification of Diabetic Retinopathy using Deep Learning Algorithms for Segmentation to Facilitate Referral Recommendation for Test and Treatment Prediction
item.description: This research paper addresses the critical challenge of diabetic retinopathy (DR), a severe complication of diabetes leading to potential blindness.

item.title: Unsupervised hard Negative Augmentation for contrastive learning
item.description: We present Unsupervised hard Negative Augmentation (UNA), a method that generates synthetic negative instances based on the term frequency-inverse document frequency (TF-IDF) retrieval model.

item.title: Multi-Stage Contrastive Regression for Action Quality Assessment
item.description: In recent years, there has been growing interest in the video-based action quality assessment (AQA).

item.title: FED-NeRF: Achieve High 3D Consistency and Temporal Coherence for Face Video Editing on Dynamic NeRF
item.description: However, achieving simultaneously multi-view consistency and temporal coherence while editing video sequences remains a formidable challenge.

item.title: Dagma-DCE: Interpretable, Non-Parametric Differentiable Causal Discovery
item.description: We introduce Dagma-DCE, an interpretable and model-agnostic scheme for differentiable causal discovery.

item.title: Let's Get It Started: Fostering the Discoverability of New Releases on Deezer
item.description: This paper presents our recent initiatives to foster the discoverability of new releases on the music streaming service Deezer.

item.title: Verifying Relational Explanations: A Probabilistic Approach
item.description: Explanations on relational data are hard to verify since the explanation structures are more complex (e. g. graphs).

item.title: CrisisViT: A Robust Vision Transformer for Crisis Image Classification
item.description: We leverage the new Incidents1M crisis image dataset to develop a range of new transformer-based image classification models.

item.title: Reading Between the Frames: Multi-Modal Depression Detection in Videos from Non-Verbal Cues
item.description: Depression, a prominent contributor to global disability, affects a substantial portion of the population.

item.title: Locally Adaptive Neural 3D Morphable Models
item.description: We present the Locally Adaptive Morphable Model (LAMM), a highly flexible Auto-Encoder (AE) framework for learning to generate and manipulate 3D meshes.

item.title: MLLM-Protector: Ensuring MLLM's Safety without Hurting Performance
item.description: The deployment of multimodal large language models (MLLMs) has brought forth a unique vulnerability: susceptibility to malicious attacks through visual inputs.

item.title: AG-ReID.v2: Bridging Aerial and Ground Views for Person Re-identification
item.description: To address this, we introduce AG-ReID. v2, a dataset specifically designed for person Re-ID in mixed aerial and ground scenarios.

item.title: Credence: Augmenting Datacenter Switch Buffer Sharing with ML Predictions
item.description: This suggests that augmenting drop-tail algorithms with predictions about the future arrivals has the potential to significantly improve performance.

item.title: FedNS: A Fast Sketching Newton-Type Algorithm for Federated Learning
item.description: We provide convergence analysis based on statistical learning for the federated Newton sketch approaches.

item.title: German Text Embedding Clustering Benchmark
item.description: This work introduces a benchmark assessing the performance of clustering German text embeddings in different domains.

item.title: DHGCN: Dynamic Hop Graph Convolution Network for Self-supervised Point Cloud Learning
item.description: Recent works attempt to extend Graph Convolution Networks (GCNs) to point clouds for classification and segmentation tasks.

item.title: Generating Non-Stationary Textures using Self-Rectification
item.description: This paper addresses the challenge of example-based non-stationary texture synthesis.

item.title: Identification of 4FGL uncertain sources at Higher Resolutions with Inverse Discrete Wavelet Transform
item.description: In the forthcoming era of big astronomical data, it is a burden to find out target sources from ground-based and space-based telescopes.

item.title: Learning Image Demoireing from Unpaired Real Data
item.description: The proposed method, referred to as Unpaired Demoireing (UnDeM), synthesizes pseudo moire images from unpaired datasets, generating pairs with clean images for training demoireing models.

item.title: PeFoMed: Parameter Efficient Fine-tuning on Multimodal Large Language Models for Medical Visual Question Answering
item.description: Multimodal large language models (MLLMs) represent an evolutionary expansion in the capabilities of traditional large language models, enabling them to tackle challenges that surpass the scope of purely text-based applications.

item.title: Diffbody: Diffusion-based Pose and Shape Editing of Human Images
item.description: Because this initial textured body model has artifacts due to occlusion and the inaccurate body shape, the rendered image undergoes a diffusion-based refinement, in which strong noise destroys body structure and identity whereas insufficient noise does not help.

item.title: Enhancing targeted transferability via feature space fine-tuning
item.description: Adversarial examples (AEs) have been extensively studied due to their potential for privacy protection and inspiring robust neural networks.

item.title: Open-Vocabulary SAM: Segment and Recognize Twenty-thousand Classes Interactively
item.description: The CLIP and Segment Anything Model (SAM) are remarkable vision foundation models (VFMs).

item.title: Scaling and Masking: A New Paradigm of Data Sampling for Image and Video Quality Assessment
item.description: In this work, instead of stacking up models, a more elegant data sampling method (named as SAMA, scaling and masking) is explored, which compacts both the local and global content in a regular input size.

item.title: Mining Fine-Grained Image-Text Alignment for Zero-Shot Captioning via Text-Only Training
item.description: Firstly, we observe that the CLIP's visual feature of image subregions can achieve closer proximity to the paired caption due to the inherent information loss in text descriptions.

item.title: Task Oriented Dialogue as a Catalyst for Self-Supervised Automatic Speech Recognition
item.description: We demonstrate that our CLC family of approaches can improve the performance of ASR models on OD3, a new public large-scale semi-synthetic meta-dataset of audio task-oriented dialogues, by up to 19. 2%.

item.title: t-DGR: A Trajectory-Based Deep Generative Replay Method for Continual Learning in Decision Making
item.description: Deep generative replay has emerged as a promising approach for continual learning in decision-making tasks.

item.title: Explore Human Parsing Modality for Action Recognition
item.description: Multimodal-based action recognition methods have achieved high success using pose and RGB modality.

item.title: Cool-Chic: Perceptually Tuned Low Complexity Overfitted Image Coder
item.description: This paper summarises the design of the Cool-Chic candidate for the Challenge on Learned Image Compression.

item.title: Spikformer V2: Join the High Accuracy Club on ImageNet with an SNN Ticket
item.description: To the best of our knowledge, this is the first time that the SNN achieves 80+% accuracy on ImageNet.

item.title: Distillation-based fabric anomaly detection
item.description: Given the extensive variability in colors, textures, and defect types, fabric defect detection poses a complex and challenging problem in the field of patterned textures inspection.

item.title: Learning to Prompt with Text Only Supervision for Vision-Language Models
item.description: While effective, most of these works require labeled data which is not practical, and often struggle to generalize towards new datasets due to over-fitting on the source data.

item.title: Graph Neural Networks for Tabular Data Learning: A Survey with Taxonomy and Directions
item.description: In this survey, we dive into Tabular Data Learning (TDL) using Graph Neural Networks (GNNs), a domain where deep learning-based approaches have increasingly shown superior performance in both classification and regression tasks compared to traditional methods.

item.title: Policy-regularized Offline Multi-objective Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In this paper, we aim to utilize only offline trajectory data to train a policy for multi-objective RL.

item.title: ClassWise-SAM-Adapter: Parameter Efficient Fine-tuning Adapts Segment Anything to SAR Domain for Semantic Segmentation
item.description: Compared to conventional state-of-the-art semantic segmentation algorithms by extensive experiments, CWSAM showcases enhanced performance with fewer computing resources, highlighting the potential of leveraging foundational models like SAM for specific downstream tasks in the SAR domain.

item.title: Unified Diffusion-Based Rigid and Non-Rigid Editing with Text and Image Guidance
item.description: Existing text-to-image editing methods tend to excel either in rigid or non-rigid editing but encounter challenges when combining both, resulting in misaligned outputs with the provided text prompts.

item.title: DCR-Consistency: Divide-Conquer-Reasoning for Consistency Evaluation and Improvement of Large Language Models
item.description: Evaluating the quality and variability of text generated by Large Language Models (LLMs) poses a significant, yet unresolved research challenge.

item.title: Secure Control of Connected and Automated Vehicles Using Trust-Aware Robust Event-Triggered Control Barrier Functions
item.description: We address the security of a network of Connected and Automated Vehicles (CAVs) cooperating to safely navigate through a conflict area (e. g., traffic intersections, merging roadways, roundabouts).

item.title: Siamese Residual Neural Network for Musical Shape Evaluation in Piano Performance Assessment
item.description: Understanding and identifying musical shape plays an important role in music education and performance assessment.

item.title: Robot-Assisted Deep Venous Thrombosis Ultrasound Examination using Virtual Fixture
item.description: To ensure the biometric measurements obtained in different examinations are comparable, the 6D scanning path is determined in a coarse-to-fine manner using both an external RGBD camera and US images.

item.title: Reassessing the Exon-Foldon correspondence using Frustration Analysis
item.description: Protein folding and evolution are intimately linked phenomena.

item.title: Linguistic Profiling of Deepfakes: An Open Database for Next-Generation Deepfake Detection
item.description: The two distinguished features enable DFLIP-3K to develop a benchmark that promotes progress in linguistic profiling of deepfakes, which includes three sub-tasks namely deepfake detection, model identification, and prompt prediction.

item.title: GUESS:GradUally Enriching SyntheSis for Text-Driven Human Motion Generation
item.description: The whole text-driven human motion synthesis problem is then divided into multiple abstraction levels and solved with a multi-stage generation framework with a cascaded latent diffusion model: an initial generator first generates the coarsest human motion guess from a given text description; then, a series of successive generators gradually enrich the motion details based on the textual description and the previous synthesized results.

item.title: Generating synthetic data for neural operators
item.description: In this paper, we propose a new approach to generating synthetic functional training data that does not require solving a PDE numerically.

item.title: TinyLlama: An Open-Source Small Language Model
item.description: We present TinyLlama, a compact 1. 1B language model pretrained on around 1 trillion tokens for approximately 3 epochs.

item.title: LLaVA-$Ï†$: Efficient Multi-Modal Assistant with Small Language Model
item.description: In this paper, we introduce LLaVA-$\phi$ (LLaVA-Phi), an efficient multi-modal assistant that harnesses the power of the recently advanced small language model, Phi-2, to facilitate multi-modal dialogues.

item.title: DiffusionEdge: Diffusion Probabilistic Model for Crisp Edge Detection
item.description: With the recent success of the diffusion probabilistic model (DPM), we found it is especially suitable for accurate and crisp edge detection since the denoising process is directly applied to the original image size.

item.title: BA-SAM: Scalable Bias-Mode Attention Mask for Segment Anything Model
item.description: In this paper, we reformulate this issue as a length extrapolation problem, where token sequence length varies while maintaining a consistent patch size for images of different sizes.

item.title: LLaMA Pro: Progressive LLaMA with Block Expansion
item.description: Humans generally acquire new skills without compromising the old; however, the opposite holds for Large Language Models (LLMs), e. g., from LLaMA to CodeLLaMA.
